summary: The Unemployment Insurance Modernization and Recession Readiness Act (H.R. 4439) aims to modernize unemployment compensation benefits. Key provisions include full federal funding of extended unemployment compensation, improvements to extended benefit triggers and duration during high unemployment, and enhanced calculations for extended benefit accounts. It also addresses regular unemployment benefits, including floors for benefit duration and wage replacement, and introduces a jobseeker allowance. The bill further incorporates provisions on worker rights, including those related to self-employment, short-time compensation, and employee status. Finally, it addresses dependents' allowances and emergency enhanced unemployment compensation during public health or disaster emergencies.
